title: Election 2012 exit polls : percentage of votes by income
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Barack Obama, and Mitt Romney. The y axis indicates the SOME LABEL and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Barack Obama is gradually increasing, Mitt Romney is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Barack Obama, and lastly, 2. Mitt Romney.
Overall across the Year, Barack Obama mostly maintained the highest SOME LABEL when compared to others with a mean value of 52.25, and it peaked at Under_30000.
The botommost line, Mitt Romney,  has a mean of 46.0, and peaked at 100000_or_more.
The difference of SOME LABEL between Barack Obama and Mitt Romney is greater at Year Under_30000 compared to the Year 100000_or_more.
